@wjchat And if video is involved, sometimes you can cite fair-use violation to block its spread. #wjchat https://t.co/b1bO2sQloh
@wjchat That's again when a network is handy. Enlist your supporters to also report malicious accounts. #wjchat https://t.co/gzjNlXMssW
@wjchat Unfortunately, TOS wasn't much help. Twitter in particular often said it found no harassing behavior.â€¦ https://t.co/aENGdSsMUw
@wjchat Also be sure to lock down your accounts with multi-factor authentication if you haven't already. #wjchat https://t.co/VP9FoEWM6i
@wjchat But if you have a newsroom PR dept., that's a big help. If not, use your journalism network (that's when meâ€¦ https://t.co/kFk3uYlGD9
@wjchat I think I already knew: It's fruitless to engage most of the trolls. So I didn't directly respond to anyoneâ€¦ https://t.co/a9VmPturNx
@wjchat And this @lamthuyvo visualization really brings home how many mentions I was getting related to the mistakeâ€¦ https://t.co/hXyTWag2zW
@wjchat I was grateful to have @washingtonpost support throughout the ordeal and published this pieceâ€¦ https://t.co/ap8mSY8BZE
@wjchat The misidentification snowballed when Gateway Pundit and Drudge picked up the story early the next morningâ€¦ https://t.co/6VHWuALZfj
@wjchat The problem was: I was never there. People mistook me for another Asian American woman. #wjchat https://t.co/6KUEDofApm
@wjchat One night, I got messages accusing me of â€œsneakilyâ€ taking pix at confirmation hearing for SecState nomineeâ€¦ https://t.co/czPBnx3Bec
